name: NCA oxide production, for Li-ion battery | NCA oxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25130/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg nickel cobalt aluminium (NCA) oxide in Chinese industry, and it is used as active material in the production NCA cathodes in Li-ion batteries. 

The activity starts when NCA hydroxide and other chemicals enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production at factory gate of NCA oxide via calcination process.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2016 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The values in this dataset come from large-scale industrial production companies located in China and are assumed to be representative of the production of NCA oxide in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: NCA oxide is produced through a multi-step calcination process. NCA hydroxide and lithium hydroxide are mixed and heated in the calcination kiln over two or three rounds of mixing and calcination. Oxygen is also add to the mixture.The resulting material is crushed, sieved and demagnetized to obtain NCA oxide. The production process is completely automated and almost all electricity consumption is attributed to the calcination kiln. The facility can achieve an overall material efficiency of approximately100%.;;The general reaction is the following:;;NCA(OH)2 + LiOH + 0.25 O2 --> Li-NCA-O2 + 2.5 H20;Reference: ;;Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data about the production process of NCA oxide are retrieved from the literature (see published source field). The value of water emissions is calculated to obtain mass balance; the value of infrastructure is calculated as representative of the production site.

flow.name: NCA oxide

exchanges.description: Calculated value to obtain mass balance, based on the following reaction: NCA(OH)2 + LiOH + 0.25 O2 --> Li-NCA-O2 + 2.5 H20

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature. NCA precursor input according to the following reaction: NCA(OH)2 + LiOH + 0.25 O2 --> Li-NCA-O2 + 2.5 H20. Value available in GREET2 2018 model (https://greet.es.anl.gov/greet.models) based on the update of Benavides et al. 2016 (Benavides, P.T., Dai, Q., Kelly, J., Dunn, J.B., 2016. Addition of nickel cobalt aluminium (NCA) cathode material to GREET2. Report, Argonne National Laboratory

Calculated value. Annual production: 27000 metric ton cathode material (Dai et al., 2018) and 50yr lifetime chemical factory

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value 24.765 mmBTU/ton NMC811 oxide taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National Laboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dai et al. (2018). Conversion factor: 1 mmBTU = 293.07135 kWh

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
